description:
Instead of just reporting whats been scanned, it paraphrases it. Extra words are added and some words are either left out or altered. If you want a verbatim conversion this is not for you. 
On the other hand it was quick and worked first time. Not for me though!
Worse than anything I've ever seen
Works fast and thorough, will use it again. Keep it up!

Works well on scans of flat paper, e.g. those taken via flatbed scanner. However, some manual adjustment is needed first, for scans of text that isn't close to horizontal, e.g. images of books with arcing text. Easily solved by running the image through GIMP first and using tools such as skew.
Not a perfect reflection but very useful for word counts or to work with text.

600 dpi scan has an image of "bad quality" or "unrecognized" or whatever, it always starts scanning with English language preset, other languages can be used after the initial scan already failed, bad theming of the application itself (dark font on dark background) ... Kind of useless.
Simple and it works. Only 4 stars because of the unorthodox GUI which isn't to my taste.
Purchased Lifetime Plan , i love this application, simple and powerful UI. loved it,
Very impressive and I am so glad that I found this very snappy application.
Although it appeared to translate most of the pdf document, words were drastically changed to what appears to be synonyms of the original word.
i loved it. atleast solved my problem. purchased life time plan

subj.
One star for not mentioning this simple fact.
When people are downloading software in Ubuntu store they expect it to be free. This program stopped working after couple of weeks and demanded payment.

I can use PDF2GO without having re-boot in Windows, and without having to print and then scan my PDF documents.
PDF2GO's OCR text recognition is not as accurate as that of the Windows software that came with my scanner/printer.
It would be nice if PDF2GO would scan the entire document, rather than scanning pages one at a time.

I have scanned printed A4 size pages of text ( the text is shell script code) that was printed in a monospaced font( Courier 12-point) on white paper (black text on white background). The scanned images look perfect, no visible noise, wide margins.

I scanned the pages with 600x600dpi resolution, black/white text , into image files (jpeg).

Tried pdf2ocr on the resulting image, but it does not recognize or messes-up many typical special characters
used in programming of shell scripts ( for example # , or [], ${variable} etc. ).

In some cases it converts these to other groups of characters (for example some # may be converted to "He" or "Ht" etc.
So the resulting text is so inaccurate that it defeats the purpose of OCR.
Possibly better suited to plain natural language OCR and unsuitable for OCR for program-code such as shell-script.

My version was 0.2, which installed as a snap on ubuntu 20.04. Would not use this program until my use-case is supported.
summary: Does not recognize smbols (like shell script special characters)

description: The scanning and initial conversion seem to work well. Unfortunately the multi-language support then takes over and converts the text to something different to the original, even if it is in the same language as the original. While the meaning may be similar, it is not the same, and this makes it useless for any formal documents, as you spend as much time finding and correcting ideosyncratic changes to the language as you would just typing a document in manually.
summary: Scans and converts but also changes language

description:
Does not allow export as an OCR-enhanced PDF.
Also, it is indeed slow to fire at first run
summary: Does not allow export as an OCR-enhanced PDF

description: Seid meinem Update auf Jammy Jellyfish 22.04 LTS. Davor hat es sehr gut geklappt. Auch wenn man die Seiten einzeln machen mußte. Schade damit muß ich ein anderes Programm suchen welche die gleichen Möglichkeiten hat. Wäre Super, wenn es auch bei 22.04 LTS wieder klappen würde. Ich habe schon alles Möglichkeiten die im Internet angesagt wurden ausprobiert.
summary: funktioniert nicht mehr seid Update auf 22.04 LTS

description: Leider kommt kein brauchbarer Text raus. Ä Ö Ü kann das Programm scheint's nicht. Satzzeichen werden zu ganzen Worten, manche Buchstaben falsch erkannt, eine 1 zum großen i ... da muss zu viel nachgearbeitet werden.

Die Umsetzung erfolgt sehr schnell. Allerdings kann das Programm mit deutschen Umlauten nichts anfangen. Die Bedienoberfläche hat schlecht lesbare Farben. Leider habe ich noch nicht herausgefunden, ob und wie man das ändern kann.

Bei mindestens einem, meist aber mehreren Fehlern pro Satz, bewegt sich die Schrifterkennung auf dem Niveau eines schlechten Übersetzungsprogramms. Für meinen Anwendungszweck nicht brauchbar und weit unter dem, was ich von anderen OCR-Programmen kenne.

Leider werden Wörter ungewollt übersetzt (z.B. "Bau" in "Construction").
Nach Texterkennung eines jpg lässt sich das Ergebnis nur als Reintext speichern - nicht als PDF. Es bleibt also hohes Verbesserungspotenzial.

Tried it on (ubuntu 18.04.6) a pdf, which I didn't believe to allow OCR at all because of rather poor print. But PDF2OCR did beautifully.
If I may utter a wish: Please add a "go to page:"-option.
No funciona en ubuntu 22.04 LTS
No traduce bien al español y no veo que se pueda configurar a algún idioma.
Manque plugin wayland-egl.
Je reste sur ma faim

Déforme les mots, alors que j'ai un PDF en français et que je souhaite avoir le même texte en français au format texte. Par exemple quand il remplace statuts par lois cela change le sens du texte.
Il crée trop d'imprécisions.
Оказывается это бесплатная пробная версия. Ни чего не смогла распознать...
